examples: By degrees their business relationship grew into friendship.
The temperature outside is nineteen degrees Celsius.
The temperature dropped to minus eighty degrees Celsius in Antarctica.
Rivalries and prejudice were by degrees fading out.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality
words.defineVi: một vị trí trên thang đo cường độ hoặc số lượng hoặc chất lượng

examples: Now, like induction, abduction doesn’t give us certainty.
There's no certainty as to when.
Sputnik shatters certain American certainties and a sense of security.
Inductive arguments don’t provide you with certainty.
Because before taxes, the only certainty was death.
words.defineEn: the state of being sure about something, usually when there is proof
words.defineVi: trạng thái chắc chắn về điều gì đó, thường là khi có bằng chứng

examples: That ship of yours clearly has had her day.
The photographs clearly show a broken window.
That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
She was clearly speaking the truth.
The witness was clearly lying through his teeth.
When the man in the fancy suit walked into the biker bar, it was obvious that he was a square peg.
The writing is on the wall and the warnings steadily become more obvious.
Michael will attempt to hide his age by wearing youthful clothing, but it will be obvious he's mutton dressed as lamb.
This may seem obvious to you.
The jokes were all so obvious you could see them coming a mile off.
words.defineVi: đáng chú ý và dễ hiểu

examples: Most families have one or two skeletons in the closet.
Most students are close to the breadline.
Men still hold most positions of power in this country.
Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: having the greatest amount, quantity, or degree
words.defineVi: có số lượng, số lượng hoặc mức độ lớn nhất

examples: The film looks likely to offend many people.
This move is likely to raise alarm bells with the French government.
The proposals are likely to mean another hundred closures.
Capital spending this year is likely to hit $1,800 million.
"That's a likely story!"
words.defineEn: having a possibility of happening or being the case
words.defineVi: có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
Probably the only one who can see the forest for the trees.
He probably got them off the back of a truck.
We should probably invest in a good home security system.
I can probably reach him on his mobile.
words.defineEn: used for saying that something is likely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: The company bets its bottom dollar when it spends a lot of money on advertising.
The company hedged its bets by developing a second line of products.
I bet his ears are burning right now.
She hedged her bets by applying for various other jobs as well.
The pilot's best bet was to make an emergency landing.
words.defineEn: used to express that one is sure about something or thinks that something is very likely
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một người chắc chắn về điều gì đó hoặc nghĩ rằng điều gì đó rất có thể xảy ra

examples: Little things please little minds, I suppose.
I'm just down in the doldrums a bit, I suppose.
I suppose there is no end to the depth of some people's idiocy.
I suppose what can you expect from a hog but a grunt?
Of course, I suppose 20 years does make a lot of difference.
words.defineEn: to think or believe that something is possible or true, without being sure
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ hoặc tin rằng một cái gì đó là có thể hoặc đúng, mà không chắc chắn

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
You know, maybe that old guy was yanking our chain.
They've suffered a heart attack, maybe two.
If you're not prepared to handle the pressure, then maybe this job isn't for you.
Maybe I should take a leaf out of Rick's book and start coming in early every morning.
words.defineEn: used to show that you are uncertain about the occurrence, correctness, or truth of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng bạn không chắc chắn về sự xuất hiện, tính chính xác hoặc sự thật của một cái gì đó

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: Wonders never cease!
Wonders never cease!
Will wonders ever cease?
Would wonders ever cease?
Would wonders never cease?!
words.defineEn: to want to know about something particular
words.defineVi: muốn biết về một cái gì đó cụ thể
